title: Harmonic Half-Life Predictor: Nuclear Decay Prediction from Geometric Quantization
description: A nuclear decay half-life prediction framework based on geometric quantization and harmonic resonance. This archive contains complete code, data, results, and documentation for predicting half-lives of 3,530 nuclei using a 3-family harmonic resonance model. Key features: (1) Universal selection rule |ΔN| ≤ 1 for allowed transitions, (2) 99.7% accuracy for beta- decay direction, (3) Complete transparency with PROCESS_AND_METHODS.md for scientific verification, (4) Nuclear spectroscopy framework with yrast diagrams, (5) Validated against 47 experimental isotopes.
notes: This software predicts nuclear decay half-lives using geometric quantization. It includes: (1) Python scripts for classification and prediction, (2) AME2020 nuclear data, (3) Experimental validation dataset (47 isotopes), (4) Complete predictions for 3,530 nuclei, (5) Comprehensive documentation including PROCESS_AND_METHODS.md for transparency, (6) All figures and validation plots. RMSE: Alpha 3.87, Beta- 2.91, Beta+ 7.75 log units.
